channel.title: Forum/server integration (Minecraft names)
channel.description:
Has this gone ahead yet? And also I've been thinking on the telenim case, when a person is banned in game they can easily change their name on the profile page and be allows back onto the server. If we really want to slow people down from ban evading it should lock them out from changing there already existing profile (Meaning they would have to re register in order to play + verify).
example:
I've been banned in game, I change my name on the cracked client, then on my forum profile. It should return an error on the forums stating I don't have the ability to do so because I've been banned, and that is ban evading. Therefore I would have to re register in order to login.
Meaning people [b]would[/b] get bored of ban evading. This current game of wait and see isn't working.

item.title: Forum/server integration (Minecraft names)
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I’d rather just set a field to ban them on the forum, like I’d make a group like ‘banned from mc’, make you guys moderators on it, then you just add them to that group and they can never get on the server again.

Would that work?

Also, does anyone want to incorporate this code in xAuth themselves? I’ve just had basically no time to program lately:

import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.DataOutputStream;
import java.io.InputStreamReader;
import java.net.HttpURLConnection;
import java.net.URL;
import java.net.URLEncoder;

public class Auth {

    public static String authURL = "https://www.moparisthebest.com/auth.php?field=minecra";
    public static double version = 1.0;

    public static boolean check_auth(String user, String pass, StringBuilder response) {
        // if authURL is null, then we are just running the server for test purposes
        // this will never be so in production
        if(authURL == null){
            response.append("TestUser");
            return true;
        }
        try {
            user = URLEncoder.encode(user, "UTF-8");
            pass = URLEncoder.encode(pass, "UTF-8");

            HttpURLConnection.setFollowRedirects(false);
            HttpURLConnection uc = (HttpURLConnection) new URL(authURL).openConnection();

            uc.setRequestMethod("POST");
            uc.setDoInput(true);
            uc.setDoOutput(true);
            uc.setUseCaches(false);
            uc.setAllowUserInteraction(false);
            uc.setInstanceFollowRedirects(false);
            uc.setRequestProperty("User-Agent", "Mozilla/5.0 MoparCraft/" + version);
            uc.setRequestProperty("Content-Type", "application/x-www-form-urlencoded");
            DataOutputStream out = new DataOutputStream(uc.getOutputStream());
            out.writeBytes("user=" + user + "&pass=" + pass);
            out.flush();
            out.close();

            BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(uc.getInputStream()));
            String line = in.readLine();
            boolean success = line != null && line.equals("YES");
            response.append(in.readLine());
            in.close();
            return success;
        } catch (Exception e) {
            response.append(e.getMessage());
            return false;
        }
    }

    public static void main(String[] args){
        String user = "davidi2";
        String pass = "badpass";
        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
        System.out.println("success: "+check_auth(user, pass, sb));
        System.out.println("message: "+sb.toString());
    }
}

If one of you could do that, it could go live right now, as the php code is already written. The authURL needs to be in the configuration file, otherwise we should be good. Message contains the forum name of the user on success, and the error message on failure. The error message can be displayed directly to the user, maybe the forum name could be displayed like ‘Welcome Ituharu (LilXCj)’ to the server, something like that maybe.
